abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the National Seed and
            Quarantine Project for Nigeria were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, project sustainability was uncertain,
            Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance
            was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            successful project take-off and implementation require
            strong initial support to the management in the form of
            project facilitation training (PFT) and supervision missions
            early in the life of the project. The absence of these
            support activities for the NSQP led to considerable delays
            in recruitment of technical assistance staff and
            commencement of procurement delays in appointments of
            consultants and procurements of goods and services
            substantially reduce the potential contribution of these
            facilities to project implementation and impact - many of
            the civil works projects were uncompleted, equipment were
            either not yet installed or required to be connected to
            utilities to become functional, and some of the training
            that should have been provided by the consultants on various
            equipment was lost. Cost of ancillary civil works, such as
            housing of equipment, electricity and water supply, service
            roads, etc., should be included in project costs.
